document.title: Wisconsin's Model Academic Standards for Business

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FDF5360DFE80131FECF68A86D17958E.description: Experience paid school- and work-based opportunities related to business occupational cluster

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FDEEEA0DFE80131FECE68A86D17958E.description: Develop a database of professional organizations related to chosen career cluster

4FDE93A0DFE80131FECD68A86D17958E.description: Explain the benefits of professional involvement
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FDE3C30DFE80131FECC68A86D17958E.description: Identify a network of business people who will provide assistance in securing a job
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FDDF0F0DFE80131FECB68A86D17958E.description: Explain the need for flexible career planning
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FDD5630DFE80131FEC968A86D17958E.description: Identify strategies to use to upgrade and improve performance
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FDCF270DFE80131FEC868A86D17958E.description: Develop strategies to acquire skills needed for business career cluster
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FDCA140DFE80131FEC768A86D17958E.description: Identify how one's own strengths match skills needed for business career cluster
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FDC5450DFE80131FEC668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ability to work cooperatively with other students and family members

4FDC01B0DFE80131FEC568A86D17958E.description: Describe careers of immediate family members

4FDBADF0DFE80131FEC468A86D17958E.description: Identify various types of occupations in the community

4FDB5620DFE80131FEC368A86D17958E.description: Identify what he/she needs to improve

4FDAAC80DFE80131FEC168A86D17958E.description: Identify own likes and dislikes and careers that match these preferences

4FDA5800DFE80131FEC068A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will explore careers and develop skills necessary to make meaningful decisions in a variety of business careers. Students will develop a career cluster focus based on their career development process.
comments: Career development encompasses an individual's total life. In our changing society, career enhancements and career changes will become common. Individuals must be able to use the tools, resources, and guidance made available to them to make informed decisions.

4FD9A5B0DFE80131FEBE68A86D17958E.description: Explain the different roles people assume when working in groups
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD94FE0DFE80131FEBD68A86D17958E.description: Lead a committee or preside at a meeting
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD903C0DFE80131FEBC68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways in which honesty and integrity of co-workers affect work performance
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD8B730DFE80131FEBB68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate effective consensus-building techniques in a group situation
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD86A30DFE80131FEBA68A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate etiquette when relating to business people of various cultures
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FD81970DFE80131FEB968A86D17958E.description: Participate as a member of a team in a business environment

4FD7BF20DFE80131FEB868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate professional behavior in the work environment
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD6D870DFE80131FEB668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate an acceptance of different cultural beliefs and practices
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD67A00DFE80131FEB568A86D17958E.description: Plan and present short presentations individually or as a member of a team
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FD60240DFE80131FEB468A86D17958E.description: Practice appropriate interpersonal skills in a business setting

4FD5A040DFE80131FEB368A86D17958E.description: Discuss the importance of being able to work together with people who are different from oneself

4FD55650DFE80131FEB268A86D17958E.description: Describe the advantages of working together as a team

4FD509F0DFE80131FEB168A86D17958E.description: Respect the rights and feelings of others

4FD31D20DFE80131FEAB68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will demonstrate interpersonal teamwork and leadership skills necessary to function in multicultural business settings.
comments: In order to be successful, workers need to work independently and with others, demonstrate initiative, and work efficiently in a variety of business environments.

4FD26DC0DFE80131FEA968A86D17958E.description: Discuss the effects of law on employment relations
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD10540DFE80131FEA568A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast differences in ethical and legal systems from state to state and nation to nation
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD0B0C0DFE80131FEA468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the legislative process, and exhibit an awareness of legislation affecting business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FD05900DFE80131FEA368A86D17958E.description: List the elements of a business contract, and identify and explain the various types of contracts
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FCFFAF0DFE80131FEA268A86D17958E.description: Analyze laws governing starting and maintaining a business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FCF5A10DFE80131FEA068A86D17958E.description: Describe sources of laws and their effect on individuals and society
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FCF08B0DFE80131FE9F68A86D17958E.description: Recognize community laws and their rationale

4FCEBAD0DFE80131FE9E68A86D17958E.description: Identify school rules and the rationale for these rules

4FCE68E0DFE80131FE9D68A86D17958E.description: Explain rules at home and understand the rationale for these rules

4FCE0DE0DFE80131FE9C68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will apply the basic legal principles to their roles as citizens, consumers, and employees.
comments: The knowledge of law is essential in today's society. Whether the law pertains to an individual or a business, students must understand legal principles in order to be a productive citizen and make responsible decisions that protect the individual and society at large.

4FCD6EA0DFE80131FE9A68A86D17958E.description: Understand the importance of employer/employee relations
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FCD0F80DFE80131FE9968A86D17958E.description: Recognize the role of labor and management unions

4FCCAE90DFE80131FE9868A86D17958E.description: Measure and compare established employment standards
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FCC4D90DFE80131FE9768A86D17958E.description: Describe how the organization provides for accountability through authority and responsibility
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FCBFE50DFE80131FE9668A86D17958E.description: Develop short-term strategic plans for a business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FCBAE30DFE80131FE9568A86D17958E.description: Analyze the pros and cons of different management decisions

4FCB5B80DFE80131FE9468A86D17958E.description: Contrast the different levels of management in your school building and how their responsibilities differ

4FCAE440DFE80131FE9368A86D17958E.description: Identify management positions within your school building

4FCA7960DFE80131FE9268A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will select and analyze appropriate information from the business function areas such as marketing, finance, accounting, production, and personnel of business to make informed management decisions.
comments: Students must have the ability to know where to find information needed to make decisions. The knowledge of different function areas of business and what data can be obtained from these areas is essential for students to use in both personal and business management decisions.

4FC9E420DFE80131FE9068A86D17958E.description: Identify potential problems or "hurdles" of doing business in foreign countries
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC997B0DFE80131FE8F68A86D17958E.description: Explain how changes in exchange rates affect consumers, companies that export goods, and companies that import goods
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC94730DFE80131FE8E68A86D17958E.description: Define international business terms; such as, nontariff trade barriers, tariff, quota, and balance of trade
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FC8EE00DFE80131FE8D68A86D17958E.description: Select most appropriate telecommunication methods for given international business situations

4FC89E70DFE80131FE8C68A86D17958E.description: Explain the use of names, titles, and ranks in different cultures and countries
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC84720DFE80131FE8B68A86D17958E.description: Explain appropriate business protocol in international business situations
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC7EAD0DFE80131FE8A68A86D17958E.description: Use words and phrases important to business people in a given language
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC78550DFE80131FE8968A86D17958E.description: Identify the role of translators and interpreters in international business settings
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FC71C80DFE80131FE8868A86D17958E.description: Explain the role of U.S. Customs and the customs agencies of other countries

4FC6D0D0DFE80131FE8768A86D17958E.description: Detail the processes for securing travel documents
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC68390DFE80131FE8668A86D17958E.description: Compare the resources (e.g., trade routes, transportation centers, foreign trade zones, etc.) of major cities around the world
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC63280DFE80131FE8568A86D17958E.description: Explain how time zones around the world affect businesses
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC5E0A0DFE80131FE8468A86D17958E.description: Explain the role of international business at local, regional, and national levels
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC50350DFE80131FE8268A86D17958E.description: Identify the relationship between international events and the daily conduct of business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC48AF0DFE80131FE8168A86D17958E.description: Explain advantages and disadvantages of trade agreements between and among nations
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC3F380DFE80131FE8068A86D17958E.description: List examples of international trade in the local community
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FC390A0DFE80131FE7F68A86D17958E.description: Identify a product which is produced in another country

4FC33370DFE80131FE7E68A86D17958E.description: Identify different countries in the world

4FC28F00DFE80131FE7C68A86D17958E.description: Identify a currency used in another country

4FC1BFF0DFE80131FE7B68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will develop the ability to participate in business transactions in both domestic and international business.
comments: Businesses are taking on a global focus and workers must be able to participate in both domestic and international environments in order to succeed. Therefore, students need to be able to work in a variety of business and office settings.

4FC03C50DFE80131FE7968A86D17958E.description: Develop a distribution plan for a product/service
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FBFD5C0DFE80131FE7868A86D17958E.description: Identify the steps of the selling process
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FBF7A30DFE80131FE7768A86D17958E.description: Identify factors that influence the promotional mix of a product/service

4FBF0550DFE80131FE7668A86D17958E.description: Analyze the various factors in pricing for a product/service
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FBEA190DFE80131FE7568A86D17958E.description: Analyze the life cycle of a product/service
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FBD53C0DFE80131FE7268A86D17958E.description: Describe and use a marketing plan
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FBCFE40DFE80131FE7168A86D17958E.description: Determine product/service preferences of classmates and family members

4FBC5210DFE80131FE7068A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will describe how marketing strategies are used in business to meet the needs of consumers.
comments: Marketing is connected to almost every function of business. All people in an organization are responsible for meeting the needs of their consumers and should, therefore, be familiar with the processes involved with marketing.

4FBB9BD0DFE80131FE6E68A86D17958E.description: Develop a business plan for a specific business based on the concepts of successful entrepreneurship, and defend the plan to an investor
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FBB2B80DFE80131FE6D68A86D17958E.description: Describe practices associated with cultural diversity that would impact a business moving from the national to the international marketplace

4FBAAE10DFE80131FE6C68A86D17958E.description: Diagram the organizational structure of a planned business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FBA3A10DFE80131FE6B68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the financial condition of a business based on its financial records
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB9EA20DFE80131FE6A68A86D17958E.description: Prepare financial statements for a planned business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB99840DFE80131FE6968A86D17958E.description: Identify impact of outside sources such as labor unions, trade organizations, and competition when establishing a small business
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB927E0DFE80131FE6868A86D17958E.description: Establish a means for building and maintaining customer loyalty
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FB8C8D0DFE80131FE6768A86D17958E.description: Design a business plan for a specific business

4FB84710DFE80131FE6668A86D17958E.description: Given a business dilemma, identify the problem and analyze possible solutions
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB7F520DFE80131FE6568A86D17958E.description: Research the unique contributions of entrepreneurs in the American economy
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB79F80DFE80131FE6468A86D17958E.description: Explain the cost of theft to business

4FB73210DFE80131FE6368A86D17958E.description: Identify reasons for keeping financial records

4FB6DB90DFE80131FE6268A86D17958E.description: Identify characteristics of an entrepreneur (business owner)

4FB676E0DFE80131FE6168A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will use business knowledge and preparation to develop an understanding of business operations and the ability and skills necessary to become entrepreneurs.
comments: The major components of entrepreneurship incorporate the basic structure of business (e.g., accounting/finance, economics, international business, law, marketing, and management). Therefore, it is essential for students to have an understanding of entrepreneurship and its place in the education of business.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FB58FD0DFE80131FE5F68A86D17958E.description: Explain the concepts of inflation, unemployment, and Gross Domestic Product and describe how they are measured

4FB52CD0DFE80131FE5E68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast the different types of economic systems (command, market, traditional, and mixed)
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FB4DF80DFE80131FE5D68A86D17958E.description: Understand the necessity for choices and the role of the decision-making process for analyzing individual business and societal decisions

4FB49090DFE80131FE5C68A86D17958E.description: Analyze how income will be affected by factors such as supply and demand, location, level of education, type of industry, union or non-union membership, gender, ethnicity, skill levels, work ethics, worker productivity, and market value of what workers produce
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB43D10DFE80131FE5B68A86D17958E.description: Explain the basic characteristics of international trade including absolute and comparative advantage, barriers to free trade, exchange rate, and balance of trade
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FB3DC10DFE80131FE5A68A86D17958E.description: Identify factors that can influence the prices of goods and services

4FB37A80DFE80131FE5968A86D17958E.description: Define economic wants and explain how they are satisfied

4FB31750DFE80131FE5868A86D17958E.description: Understand that productive resources are limited and that people cannot have all the goods and services they want; as a result they must choose some things and give up others. Identify the opportunity cost of a decision when one alternative is chosen

4FB2C3A0DFE80131FE5768A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will use critical-thinking skills to function as citizens who are literate about economics through development of personal consumer economic skills and a knowledge of societal and governmental responsibility.
comments: The American economy is based on a private enterprise system in which the sum total of the millions of individual choices made by consumers, workers, and citizens affect the decisions made by business owners and government officials. In order to make these informed decisions, individuals must clearly understand how the system operates while comprehending their role in the system.

4FB21950DFE80131FE5568A86D17958E.description: Use technology to maintain, manipulate, and report financial information
comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.
4FAFF490DFE80131FE4F68A86D17958E.description: Identify, prepare, and analyze financial statements

4FAECCB0DFE80131FE4D68A86D17958E.description: Calculate mathematics problems requiring adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing different denominations

4FAE6C90DFE80131FE4C68A86D17958E.description: Identify the value of each denomination

4FAE04D0DFE80131FE4B68A86D17958E.description: Recognize different denominations of currency and coins

4FADA4B0DFE80131FE4A68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will use financial procedures to make decisions about planning, organizing, and allocating resources.
comments: Making wise decisions is essential for the economic well being of our country. Students need financial knowledge to ensure they make the best decisions both personally and professionally. Whether it is daily transactions or investments for their future, students must understand how to use resources to develop economic growth.

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4FA7C4B0DFE80131FE3968A86D17958E.description: Apply special features of software packages such as galleries, templates, macros, etc.

4FA34260DFE80131FE2C68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will select and apply current information systems/technology as they relate to personal and business decision-making in light of ethical and social issues.
comments: Information systems/technology continue to change. Students must be able to select and apply from the tools available. In order to make informed decisions, the student must learn current technology as well as understand ethical and social issues related to the use of technology.

comments: This standard is for students who have completed advanced business courses.

4F974400DFE80131FE0868A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will communicate in a clear, courteous, concise, and correct manner on personal and professional levels.
